body:
Can you give this a go with [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org)?  Quite a lot of fixes went into the VFS layer in the last 30 commits! (https://beta.rclone.org has been serving old versions for a few weeks, that is part of what the VFS fixes are for!).

Also can you try it without the cache backend so we can work out whether the problem is in the cache backend or rclone mount.

> touch: cannot touch 'test': Input/output error

If you get that then I would expect to see an ERROR in the rclone log...

A quick bit of research indicates exporting FUSE filesystems via NFS might be tricky - what parameters are you using there?

Yes, please try more recent version. Much more stable, especially around uploads. I recommend to look at --cache-upload.. flags too.

But this is a basic test that would have worked even in earlier versions. If cache isn't found to be the cause through elimination, there's also this to look at:
`Mar 05 17:55:12 sbx1 rclone[880]: 2018/03/05 17:55:12 DEBUG : gdrivecache:: File to upload is small (0 bytes), uploading instead of streaming`
I've never did a test with 0 bytes, I'll add one for sanity but try another command just for kicks: `echo "test" > test` in the mount folder just to rule it out.

A combination of 0 bytes, --cache-writes definitely seems more exotic than your regular use-case so play with that too until I write some tests like this.

Hi, I will try a more recent version in the next couple days. I did already tried before the echo to have file no 0 in size and same thing.

About the logs I am using -vv and thats the only log I get, no error in the rclone logs after the not found.

issue.title: Mount to nfs server directory

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body: Is it possible to use rclone mount on a nfs server?

body:
There are some ideas here which could help: https://unix.stackexchange.com/questions/102617/having-trouble-exporting-fuse-via-nfs

In particular the NFSv4 ideas...

_Please ignore this comment._

I thought I succeeded with v1.46 and the NFSv4 ideas in that post just now, but I didn't. :(

Yupp, same here.
 rclone v1.47.0
- os/arch: linux/amd64                                                                        
- go version: go1.12.4

I'm not sure I can help with investigations at the moment, but I'm cheering you on from the sideline :-)

If anyone does successfully make it work then please write it up in [the rclone wiki](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/wiki).

Likewise if we can work out what might need to change in rclone then let me know.
How do other fuse file systems work over NFS ? Example s3QL - http://www.rath.org/s3ql-docs/mount.html

> How do other fuse file systems work over NFS ? Example s3QL - http://www.rath.org/s3ql-docs/mount.html

So it is possible but with the `--nfs` workarounds.  Anyone fancy diving into the source to figure out what they do?

hi everyone, I had the same problem with rclone version beta
Has anyone succeeded yet? Can give me advice?

I setup rclone with NFS and didn't realize I can't create files until now, and it's pretty upsetting, actually.
I can mkdir test, but I can't touch test.

I had a look at the s3ql source code to see what its --nfs option does - it looks like it is a performance optimization only and the docs agree

> S3QL filesystems can be exported over NFS. The --nfs option is recommended to improve performance when NFS is used, but no harm will occur when it is not specified.

I've investigated the problem some more and it appears that `rclone cmount` does work. The reason `rclone mount` doesn't work is that it doesn't implement the FUSE Mknod call

```
2020/10/29 14:07:02 DEBUG : fuse: <- Mknod [ID=0x2e Node=0x1 Uid=1000 Gid=1000 Pid=1370185] Name "file.txt" mode=-rw-rw-r-- umask=---------- rdev=0
2020/10/29 14:07:02 DEBUG : fuse: -> [ID=0x2e] Mknod error=EIO
```

I implemented a simple Mknod and it seems to work now - can you give this a go

[v1.54.0-beta.4869.bfcd4113c.fix-2115-nfs](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-2115-nfs/v1.54.0-beta.4869.bfcd4113c.fix-2115-nfs/) on branch [fix-2115-nfs](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-2115-nfs) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Note that you'll probably need `--vfs-cache-mode writes` with this.

Thanks for testing :-)

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.54
Thanks for fixing the issue! After I installed the beta version I could also get along the descirbed problem (after a lot of trouble shooting...). Any ideas when 1.54 will be released?

> Any ideas when 1.54 will be released?

Some time in January I expect :-)
